Left 4 Dead is one of the best zombie games out there (well it is made by Valve). Join Bill a homeless military veteran, Francis a member of the Hellâ€™s Legion, Louis an assistant manager at an electronic store chain and Zoey an ex-student as they try and escape through hordes of infected while trying to find a boat to escape to an island. I honestly donâ€™t know anyone who doesnâ€™t like the game, which is really saying a lot. It has really atmospheric tone portrayed in a dark, gritty kind of way. Humour is seen, sure, but it is scarce compared to its successor, Left 4 Dead 2, and I think this gives you a reason to play and buy both to enjoy, as they are fantastic games no matter which you prefer. I would also like to note that Left 4 Dead content was ported into Left 4 Dead 2 with the new infected, guns, melee, UI and maybe a few little changes to the map. If you canâ€™t afford both I would suggest buying the Left 4 Dead Bundle which includes both games or just buy Left 4 Dead 2. My only problem is that the online (Versus) community on this game is practically dead, which gives even more reasons to buy Left 4 Dead 2 because Valve honestly doesnâ€™t care about the online community for this game. Overall great game and should be appreciated more, 10/10.
LOVE the game and definetly recommend it for co-op. I wish they make a 3rd game! Really like that the game has a lot of propane!

The best team-oriented FPS ever created. Yes, even better than CS/CS:Source/CS:GO.

The dynamics of teamplay in Versus are incredibly complex given all the variables of the maps. Let me reiterate: THE BREAD AND BUTTER OF L4D IS VERSUS MODE!

Sadly, the creators of the game released L4D2 way too early and didn't fully flesh out L4D resulting in a massive community death of the game. 

This is still my favorite game I've ever played... tons of hours of laughter, anxiety, anger, and exhiliration.
